attributes.action: Stop the Amersham Horses being returned to their legal owners
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Horse trader James Gray, 45, and his son James Gray Junior, 16, were found guilty of 11 charges under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.

His wife Julie Gray, 41, and daughters Jodie, 26, and Cordelia Gray, 20, were each found guilty of two charges under the same act. These people are due to be sentenced next week, but the horses legally still belong to them and unless the judge rules otherwise, they could be returned into their care.
